block.p: Katherine Lynne Whitacre, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Huntley Whitacre of Hanover, N.H., was married yesterday to James Thomas Schwartz, a son of Gen. Thomas A. Schwartz of Seoul, South Korea. The Rev. Charles Gunti, a Roman Catholic priest and a retired Army chaplain, performed the ceremony in the Cantonment Chapel at Fort McPherson, Ga.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 25, graduated from Clemson University, he cum laude.

Katherine Lynne Whitacre, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Huntley Whitacre of Hanover, N.H., was married yesterday to James Thomas Schwartz, a son of Gen. Thomas A. Schwartz of Seoul, South Korea. The Rev. Charles Gunti, a Roman Catholic priest and a retired Army chaplain, performed the ceremony in the Cantonment Chapel at Fort McPherson, Ga.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 25, graduated from Clemson University, he cum laude.

Mrs. Schwartz was until last week a staff recruiter at Scientific-Atlanta, a manufacturer of cable television boxes in Atlanta. Her father retired as the senior vice president for investor relations at RJR Nabisco in New York. Her mother, Lynne Whitacre, retired as a teacher at the New Canaan (Conn.) Preschool.

Mr. Schwartz, a student at the Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, will continue his training next month at the Western Pennsylvania Hospital in Pittsburgh. His father is the commander in chief of the combined armed forces in South Korea.

WEDDINGS Correction: July 30, 2000, Sunday A report on July 16 about the marriage of Katherine Lynne Whitacre and James Thomas Schwartz omitted the identity of the bridegroom's mother. She is Sandra Schwartz.
A report on July 16 about the marriage of Katherine Lynne Whitacre and James Thomas Schwartz omitted the identity of the bridegroom's mother. She is Sandra Schwartz.
